content: The "Small Business Investment Company Amendments Act of 2001" may be cited as the Short Title. Subsidy Fees are addressed in Section 2. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to adjust subsidy fees, increasing the maximum amount to 1.38 percent per year and extending the deadline to September 30, 2001. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to adjust subsidy fees, increasing the maximum amount to 1.38 percent per year and extending the deadline to September 30, 2001. The effective date for the amendments is October 1, 2001. SEC. 3. CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. Amends Section 312 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 by removing a specific disclosure requirement. SEC. 4. PENALTIES FOR FALSE STATEMENTS. Amendment to criminal and civil penalties related to small business investment companies and the Small Business Administration. Criminal penalties under title 18, United States Code, and civil penalties under the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 are modified. The amendment modifies criminal and civil penalties related to small business investment companies and the Small Business Administration by making changes to specific paragraphs and inserting a new section. SEC. 5. REMOVAL OR SUSPENSION OF MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS. Amendment to Section 313 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 regarding the removal or suspension of management officials. SEC. 313 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 defines 'management official' as an individual involved in the management of a licensee. The Administrator can remove a management official upon serving a written notice if they have willfully committed a substantial violation. SEC. 6. REDUCTION OF FEES. Two-Year Reduction of Section 7(a) Fees: Amendment to the Small Business Act reduces guarantee fees for loans approved during a 2-year period starting October 1, 2002. The guarantee fee is 1 percent for loans up to $150,000 and 2.5 percent for loans above that amount. The amendment to the Small Business Act reduces guarantee fees for loans approved during a 2-year period starting October 1, 2002. The guarantee fee is 3.5 percent for the deferred participation share of a total loan amount over $700,000. Annual fees are also adjusted to 0.25 percent of the outstanding balance of the deferred amount. The amendment to the Small Business Act reduces guarantee fees for loans approved during a 2-year period starting October 1, 2002. The guarantee fee is 3.5 percent for the deferred participation share of a total loan amount over $700,000. Annual fees are adjusted to 0.25 percent of the outstanding balance of the deferred amount. The Small Business Act amendment reduces guarantee fees for loans approved during a 2-year period starting October 1, 2002. The Administration may not assess or collect any up front guarantee fee for loans made under this title during that period. During a 2-year period starting October 1, 2002, loans made under title V of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 will have reduced guarantee fees. The funds for these loans must be made available through appropriations Acts to offset the costs of the amendments. The amendments made by the Reform Act of 1990 will become effective on October 1, 2002.
